commits.comment: MENFORCER-16 applied site patch from Paul Gier
new rule to enforce no repositories in the poms.
[MENFORCER-20] add XML encoding support for POM reading
encoding changes require new p:u and thus maven > 2.0.6
MENFORCER-12: new rule caching system to improve rule performance on multi-module builds
MENFORCER-10: refactored api to allow better access to the container. Also added contextualize to get the real plugin container to load plugin dependencies.
MENFORCER-15: added the ability to declare the phases used to lookup lifecycles
drop junit back to be jdk1.4 compatible
MENFORCER-24 new rule to check active profiles
more unit tests for the plugin version rule
o Set eol style to Native. o Add svn keywords where they were missing.
o Add xml declaration. o Replace tabs with spaces and fix indentation.
o Minor tweaks to the documentation.
o Copy some configuration from plugins-parent. This plugin used to inherit that configuration from the plugin-parent before the move.
Configure the site plugin staging url.
MENFORCER-33 remove unused code in beanshell rule
MENFORCER-45 : plugins declared in profiles are not detected for version check

Put this message in debug. It's too annoying to have it for each module.
o Use site.xml inheritance. o Connect the different sites. o Set proper license headers.

update the license headers with jAutoDoc
new abstract class to eliminate redundant methods for rules that aren't cacheable

convert the non-cacheable rules to use the new abstract class
renamed the rule and refactored it to work like the other file rules and take an array of files to check.
o Move the documentation for the implemented rules up one level and change the links accordingly.
start of ITs to find the site plugin issue

o improved javadoc o removed unused imports
allow some plugins to be skipped in the check (make it easier to use an snapshot of the enforcer)
workaround for site report plugins tripping up the check.
